perturbation.original_text: The Agent shall receive the following compensation for its services hereunder: a. The fee shall be equal to 5.2% of the "gross proceeds" received in the Offering attributable to the efforts of the Agent. At least 48 hours prior to each Closing, the Agent shall deliver a schedule, identified as Appendix A, that lists each investor and the amount of investment.
perturbation.changed_text: The Agent shall receive compensation for its services hereunder as determined by the Company. At least 48 hours prior to each Closing, the Agent shall deliver a schedule, identified as Appendix A, that lists each investor and the amount of investment.
perturbation.explanation: The specific fee percentage (5.2%) is removed, and the determination of the fee is now at the Company's discretion. However, Appendix A is still mentioned, creating a contradiction. The original contract defined that Appendix A should contain the amount of investment. By removing this definition, it causes uncertainty as the contract refers to a process without clearly stating how payment will be defined, making enforcement ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the following: (i) the fees, disbursements and expenses of counsel to the Company and accountants in connection with the registration of the Shares under the Act and all other expenses in connection with the preparation, printing and filing of the Registration Statement, each Preliminary Prospectus, the Prospectus, each Permitted Free Writing Prospectus and any amendments or supplements thereto, and the mailing and delivering of copies thereof to the Agent and dealers; (ii) the cost of printing or reproducing this agreement, the Blue Sky Survey, any dealer agreements and any other documents in connection with the offering, purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares; (iii) all expenses in connection with the qualification of the Shares for offering and sale under state securities laws; (iv) the cost of preparing stock certificates; (v) all expenses related to road shows; (vi) the costs or expenses of any transfer agent or registrar; and (vi) all reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the Agent, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent related to the Offering and not otherwise specifically provided for in this Section; the total for all such reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses shall not exceed $5,000 without the consent of the Company (exclusive of any blue sky-related fees if the Agent's counsel is requested to complete such services by the Company).
perturbation.changed_text: Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the expenses detailed in the Expense Addendum. The specific details regarding expenses are outlined in the Expense Addendum, which will be provided separately.
perturbation.explanation: All the details about what the company has to cover for expenses is gone. It states that it will be in the Expense Addendum, but the addendum doesn't actually exist. Without the detail of expenses and their corresponding values, the contract becomes hard to execute and enforce.

perturbation.original_text: The Company and Agent agree that Appendix A is accurate and complete.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and Agent acknowledge the existence of Appendix A.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the original text, the new text doesn't affirm that it's accurate and complete. This creates a missing clause as it does not confirm the important factors needed when executing the contract.
